name: EFS Portals
title: EFS Portals
body:
Original Confluence URL: https://qbdocs.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/TS/pages/1054965869 - please cross-check the quality of the ZD article with the Confluence counterpart and remove this line before publishing the ZD article

Table of Contents

    • Activation
      • Dependencies
      • Basic information:
      • Making a portal available in the app:
      • Accessing a portal on a smartphone or tablet:
      • Push Notifications:
      • Other general information:

Activation

Dependencies

Other modules needed by Portals:

  • EFS Panel

To activate Portals, the following steps need to be done:

  • set config variables with root account in the admin area:

    • modules:

      • add "library"

      • add "portal"

  • execute healself on the server

    • i [installation]

    • cd www

    • php support/healself.php

  • create a new portal and set it to "Online", delete the portal afterwards

    • This needs to be done so that the SCSS get's compiled for the first time and we avoid having the customer to expirience broken CSS

  • update installation in Globis

    • add the module portal under modules

    • add an update: "Activated portal (case [case ID])"

Basic information:

  • App gateway:

    • appgw.customervoice360.com/login or appgw.customervoice360.com/admin

    • user: root

    • password: default root password

  • App name in app store:

    • iOS:

      • Portals: your gateway to the world of feedback, Questback GmbH?

    • Android:

      • Portals (you easily can find it by searching for "Questback")

Making a portal available in the app:

  • Login to appgw.customervoice360.com/login

  • Create a new Applink

  • Enter title, claim and portals URL

  • Activate the portal and activate further options if needed (like toolbar, reload, logout)

  • set sending header with X-Frame-Options from Portal → Settings → General settings to “Do not send”

Accessing a portal on a smartphone or tablet:

  • Download the app from the app store

  • Open the app and enter the claim (This only can be done once. If you would like to change the claim, you need to re-install the app)

  • The app accesses the app gateway to look up the URL corresponding to the claim entered

  • The content of the URL (the portal) then will be shown within the app (using an iframe or similar)

Push Notifications:

Link Sammlung:
SupportInfosZu110#Notification_center
SupportInfosZu1603#Push_notifications_to_android_io
SupportInfosZu1604#Push_notifications_to_mobile_dev
SupportInfosZu1701#Notifications
SupportInfosZu1702#Push_Notifications_App
SupportInfosZu1801#Panelist_settings

From case 00844578:
in each portal in the participant list, you can select panelists and can send them a push notification via button "Send push notification".
The panelist has to have the app installed and push notifictions enabled. The portal also has to have a claim. Otherwise the panelists of course can not access the portal via the app.

Other general information:

  • The app does not show an address bar so manually navigating to a different URL is not possible but if the portal includes a link (an external link or a link to a survey) and it is clicked, the corresponding content will be shown

  • By swiping left and right (at least iOS app) you can navigate a page back and forth (like using the corresponding browser navigation buttons

Portals Limits and other settings

In der Config (Tab "root only:: System configuration"):

Config Flag

Beschreibung

Standardlimit

Bisher max gesetzt auf

Kommentar

portal_max_quantity

maximum quantity of portals for installation

6

18(?)

Es wurde auf der Telekom Installation erhöht (internalsurveys.telekom.com, Case 00901510). Erhöht auf 18

Survey image not shown in portal survey list

  • Q: I have set an image for a survey under Project properties >> Portal settings but it is not shown in the survey list of my Portal.

  • A: Currently only images that are stored in the project specific media library can be shown in the portal survey list. Images that are stored in the common or questback library can be selected in the portal settings of the survey but are not shown in the portal. We have created a Kanban ticket for that: KANBAN-11054

Discussion board can not be viewed by panelist

  • Q: I have invited a panelist to a discussion board but this panelist can not see it. The panelist already is a member of the specific panel group that has access to the discucssion board.

  • A: Besides the general access permissions that you can set in the settings of a portal, you also can set specific access rights on the content of a portal. Please check the access settings for the discussion board on the content tab of the portal.

How many portal participants are online?

Here is how you can check how many portal participants are online

< EFS 17.4
Please check on slave DB.

  • i [installation]

  • cd conf

  • echo "SELECT count(*) as num FROM portal_user_online_status WHERE portal_id=[ID] AND DATE_SUB(NOW(), INTERVAL 300 SECOND) < current_at;" | mysql -h [host] -u [user] -p"[password]" -P [port] [database]

  • Output: num 238


>= EFS 17.4
You can add a page module in the Portals cms called statistics

  • add a new chart

  • Chart type e.g. Column chart

  • Source type = users

  • Content Type e.g. Number of online users with app

How can I log in as a panelist?

In Portals use the []-> Button to open the Portal in a new tab.

Then from the participants of this portal, choose the login you want to use and go to the panelist administration to copy the panelist’s token.

In the Portal from the new tab, in the url insert “?lc=[token from panleist administration]” in front of the # of the URL
